news_header: Yoon Suk Yeol, South Korea's impeached president, faces trial for insurrection charges after imposing martial law.
news_original_title: South Korea: President Yoon faces criminal trial
news_text: Yoon Suk Yeol, the impeached president of South Korea, appeared in court for his criminal trial regarding insurrection charges. He is the first South Korean president to face such charges. Yoon had briefly imposed martial law, leading to his impeachment. Prosecutors accuse him of being the 'ringleader of an insurrection.' His lawyers argue for more time to review evidence. The Constitutional Court is also considering his status as president. Insurrection charges carry severe penalties, but Yoon denies any wrongdoing.
